Detailed Description

This class allows to make a Bayesian estimation of a log-normal distribution with fixed shape parameter s when the prior distribution over the natural logarithm of the log-normal scale ln(m) is a normal distribution.

The conjugacy property of the normal distribution with respect to the log-normal ensures that the posterior distribution over the natural logarithm of the log-normal scale parameter is a normal distribution whose parameters can be computed analytically.

A log-normal distribution with learned parameter m (called scale) and fixed parameters s (called shape) and theta (called location) has the following probability density function:

A Normal distribution with parameters mu (called mean) and sigma (called standard deviation, square root of the variance sigma^2) has the following probability density function:

See Also

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

plBayesLearnLogNormalWithKnownShape::plBayesLearnLogNormalWithKnownShape ( )

Default constructor.

plBayesLearnLogNormalWithKnownShape::plBayesLearnLogNormalWithKnownShape ( plSymbol const &  variable,
plFloat  init_mu,
plFloat  init_sigma,
plFloat  s,
plFloat  theta 
)

Creates a learnable log-normal distribution with fixed standard deviation, where the prior over the log-normal mu (mu = exp(m) ) parameter follows a normal distribution.

Parameters
[in]variablethe variable of the learnt distribution.
[in]init_muInitial value of the mu parameter of the normal distribution over the learned log-normal mean.
[in]init_sigmaInitial value of the sigma parameter of the Normal distribution over the learned log-normal mean. It must be strictly positive.
[in]sFixed shape of the learned log-normal distribution.
[in]thetaFixed location parameter of the learned log-normal distribution.
plBayesLearnLogNormalWithKnownShape::plBayesLearnLogNormalWithKnownShape ( plSymbol const &  variable)
explicitprotected

Creates a learnable log-normal distribution, where the prior over the mean follows a normal distribution.

mu and sigma are initialized arbitrarily to 0 and 1. This constructor is here only for use with plCndLearnObject<>, it should be used with care as the arbitrary initialization of mu and sigma generally makes no sense.

virtual plBayesLearnLogNormalWithKnownShape::~plBayesLearnLogNormalWithKnownShape ( )
inlinevirtual

Destructor.

plDistribution plBayesLearnLogNormalWithKnownShape::get_aposteriori_distribution ( plVariablesConjunction const &  mu) const
virtual

Returns the normal distribution corresponding to the posterior distribution over the log-normal mean mu knowing all learned data.

Parameters
[in]muVariable that corresponds to the log-normal mean, on which to build the posterior distribution. Must be a variable with a real type.

Implements plBayesLearnObject.

unsigned int plBayesLearnLogNormalWithKnownShape::get_n_parameters ( ) const
inlinevirtual

Returns the ACTUAL number of parameters.

It could be different from the number of parameters returned by get_parameters.

For example, the actual number of parameters of a N dimensional normal distribution is N + N*(N+1)/2 because the covariance matrix is symmetric.

Implements plLearnObject.

void plBayesLearnLogNormalWithKnownShape::get_parameters ( plValues &  params) const
inlinevirtual

Returns all learnt parameters of the object (parameters passed to the distribution constructors when calling 'get_distribution').

This virtual method has to be implemented in all derived classes.
